Class ViewAddRemoveRoles

java.lang.Object
guiAddRemoveRoles.ViewAddRemoveRoles
public class ViewAddRemoveRoles extends Object

Title: GUIAddRemoveRolesPage Class.

Description: The Java/FX-based page for changing the assigned roles to users.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewAddRemoveRoles

      public ViewAddRemoveRoles()

      Method: GUIAddRemoveRolesPage()

      Description: This method initializes all the elements of the graphical user interface. This method determines the location, size, font, color, and change and event handlers for each GUI object.

      This is a singleton, so this is performed just one. Subsequent uses fill in the changeable fields using the displayAddRempoveRoles method.

  • Method Details

    • displayAddRemoveRoles

      public static void displayAddRemoveRoles(javafx.stage.Stage ps, User user)

      Method: displayAddRemoveRoles(Stage ps, User user)

      Description: This method is the single entry point from outside this package to cause the AddRevove page to be displayed. It first sets up very shared attributes so we don't have to pass parameters. It then checks to see if the page has been setup. If not, it instantiates the class, initializes all the static aspects of the GUI widgets (e.g., location on the page, font, size, and any methods to be performed). After the instantiation, the code then populates the elements that change based on the user and the system's current state. It then sets the Scene onto the stage, and makes it visible to the user.

      Parameters:
      ps - specifies the JavaFX Stage to be used for this GUI and it's methods
      user - specifies the User whose roles will be updated

    • createUserRow

      protected static javafx.scene.layout.HBox createUserRow(User user)

      Method: static HBox createUserRow(User user)

      Description: Creates and configures a single user row as an HBox for display in the user management list. This method assembles all visual components for one user entry, including: username label, roles label, optional action feedback badge, spacer, action area (with role add/remove ComboBoxes, confirm and cancel buttons), and a menu button for role management actions.

      The row is styled with a dark background, rounded corners, and responsive width binding to the parent list container. ComboBoxes are initially hidden and only shown when the user selects "Add Role..." or "Remove Role..." from the menu. A custom ListCell is applied to ensure the prompt text ("Select") reliably reappears after selections and resets.

      Event handlers are attached to handle role addition/removal, database updates, UI refresh, and visual feedback via a persistent colored badge (green for add, red for remove).

      Parameters:
      user - the User object whose username, roles, and role flags (adminRole, newRole1, newRole2) are used to populate and update this row
      Returns:
      the fully configured HBox representing one user row, ready to be added to a list or container

    • setupButtonUI

      protected static void setupButtonUI(javafx.scene.control.Button b, String ff, double f, double w, javafx.geometry.Pos p, double x, double y)
      Private local method to initialize the standard fields for a button
      Parameters:
      b - The Button object to be initialized
      ff - The font to be used
      f - The size of the font to be used
      w - The width of the Button
      p - The alignment (e.g. left, centered, or right)
      x - The location from the left edge (x axis)
      y - The location from the top (y axis)
